project_details:
Inspiration

We believe that LLMs can be wonderful tools to assist individuals with inner work and self-reflection. Their ability to emulate and mirror the personality, values and principles of real, historical, fictional and archetypal characters opens up fascinating opportunities for meaningful conversations that resonate with us and what we are looking for in mentorship and outside perspectives.

This project was made inspired by the wonderful work of Andrew Blevins and Jason Gnaz with insight-cascade, who pioneered the original concept of using Claude to build an advisory council for personal reflection and inner exploration.

What it does

council.ai or 'the council' asks you a series of questions about different aspects of your life, who you are, what you value, what matters to you, what inspires you, etc. Using this information we use a detailed and layered prompt to search the entirety of latent space for 10 current, historical, fictional or archetypal characters that might be most suitable for giving their perspectives to you about your problems, issues or questions. We use Fal AI to generate images of all ten of these and we use Claude Sonnet 3-5 to generate descriptions and justifications for why each was chosen for the individual.

From this ten we allow the user to select the 3 most suitable for them. Once they do we use ElevenLabs Voice Design to custom generate an appropriate voice for each council members. Then we're ready to have a conversation.

The user asks a simple or detailed question and using a sophisticated prompt we generated answers that pull in wisdom from all 3 advisors. The advisors are able to respond to the user and each other in-kind to build on different aspects of the conversation. As the conversation continues the user is able to explore deeper and deeper aspects of their lives from different perspectives.

How we built it

  • Built using next.js with serverless functions.
  • Supabase for postgresSQL db and authentication
  • Claude Sonnet 3-5 for primary inference and character generation
  • AI-generated images of your advisors using Fal AI flux-lora
  • Unique voice synthesis for each advisor using ElevenLabs Voice Design API
  • TTS API with ElevenLabs with custom voice for authentic advisor interactions
  • OpenAI Whisper for transcription

Challenges we ran into

Many. Principally, ElevenLabs has very strict copyright policies in voice design. You can't mention a specific person in the prompt or it will refuse the request. To get around this we iterated on and came up with a great prompt that allowed Claude to generate just the right information about what a given characters voice would sound like and feed that into the voice design API, getting us about 90% of the way there to an authentic representation of the characters voice.

We also found that the Claude API calls and voice design API calls often took longer than we anticipated. To the point where Vercel's function calls were timing out. Luckily, one of our teamates had a Pro plan so we were able to push out the timeout period. Additionally we redeployed on fluidcompute which improved things significantly.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

Honestly, the whole thing! We were able to go from creative idea to execution and get a fully working app up in less than a day that integrated 5-6 different AI technologies and was actually usable and useful.

The whole team worked so well together and divvyd up the work well and each contributed significantly.

We're particularly proud of the voice-gen workaround that we came up with as that was almost going to be a show stopper for us initially.

What we learned

We tested the waters with a lot of new APIs such as voice design and Fal AI and figured out how to creatively stitch different AI tools together. Also that Anthropic does quite reliable structured outputs purely via prompting.

What's next for council.ai

It depends. Currently it would be too expensive to host this as a public product due to the cost of the APIs for conversation and image gen we're using. But we think there may be real use for a purely text-based version of this and so we will most likely look at refactoring and deploying and putting it out there for anyone to use.
advocate:
Let me provide a structured analysis of council-ai based on the judging criteria:

Impact (25%)
- Strong potential for meaningful personal development and mental health support
- Addresses a growing need for accessible self-reflection and mentorship tools
- Scalability potential through text-based version shows practical thinking
- Could have significant societal impact by making wisdom and guidance more accessible
- Shows awareness of cost considerations for long-term viability

Technical Implementation (25%)
- Impressive integration of multiple cutting-edge AI technologies:
  * Claude Sonnet for character generation and conversations
  * ElevenLabs Voice Design for custom voice synthesis
  * Fal AI for image generation
  * OpenAI Whisper for transcription
- Well-architected tech stack with Next.js, Supabase, and serverless functions
- Creative problem-solving around API limitations (voice generation workaround)
- Successfully handled technical challenges like API timeout issues

Creativity and Innovation (25%)
- Unique approach to personal development through AI-powered historical/fictional advisors
- Novel combination of multiple AI technologies to create immersive experience
- Creative solution to voice generation copyright restrictions
- Innovative use of character generation to provide diverse perspectives
- Building on existing concepts (insight-cascade) while adding significant innovations

Pitch and Presentation (25%)
- Clear and well-structured project presentation
- Excellent documentation of inspiration, functionality, and technical details
- Transparent about challenges and future considerations
- Strong articulation of value proposition
- Honest about limitations and future directions

Standout Strengths:
1. Holistic integration of multiple AI technologies to create a cohesive experience
2. Strong focus on practical user value and personal development
3. Creative problem-solving around technical limitations
4. Clear vision for future development and scaling considerations
5. Impressive execution in a short timeframe (less than a day)

This project demonstrates excellent technical implementation while maintaining a clear focus on providing real value to users. The team shows both technical expertise and thoughtful consideration of the human aspects of their solution.
critic:
Here's my critical analysis of council-ai based on the judging rubric:

Impact (25%):
- Major Concerns:
  * Cost-prohibitive for widespread adoption due to expensive API usage
  * Limited scalability in current form due to high operational costs
  * No clear monetization strategy or path to sustainability
  * Lacks validation of actual therapeutic or counseling benefits
  * Potential ethical concerns around replacing human counselors/mentors

Technical Implementation (25%):
- Weaknesses:
  * Heavy reliance on multiple third-party APIs creates multiple points of failure
  * API timeout issues suggest underlying architectural problems
  * Workarounds for voice generation limitations indicate technical constraints
  * No mention of error handling or fallback mechanisms
  * Unclear how system handles context and conversation history

Creativity and Innovation (25%):
- Limitations:
  * Core concept is admittedly inspired by existing project (insight-cascade)
  * Voice generation approach is more of a workaround than innovation
  * Character selection process could be more sophisticated
  * Limited to text-based interactions with basic voice overlay
  * Lacks truly novel technological advancement

Pitch and Presentation (25%):
- Areas for Improvement:
  * No clear metrics or evidence of effectiveness
  * Missing details about user testing or feedback
  * Vague about specific use cases and target audience
  * No discussion of privacy considerations for personal conversations
  * Limited information about competitive advantage

Additional Critical Points:
1. The project seems more like a proof-of-concept than a viable product
2. No mention of safeguards against potential misuse or harmful advice
3. Unclear how the system handles complex emotional or psychological issues
4. Dependencies on multiple AI services make it vulnerable to service disruptions
5. No apparent consideration for accessibility or inclusive design

Overall, while technically interesting, the project faces significant challenges in terms of practical implementation, scalability, and real-world impact. The team should focus on addressing these fundamental issues before considering wider deployment.
